result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone Lee Sias Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, due by June 22, 2015. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not any firearms.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.  
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone Lee Sias Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, due by June 22, 2015. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Pretrial Sentence Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief;
Inegligible Voting and Notice and Acknowledgment

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Proceeded to plea hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Tyrone Lee Sias not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Scheduling conference held off the record. Court is in jury trial on another matter.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 5-21-2015 at 1:30 pm, and Jury Trial scheduled on 6-22-2015 at 9:00 am, Branch 17. Any motions due no later than May 5, 2015 by 5:00 pm. And any response is due no later than May 19, 2015 by 5:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Calendar call scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court with Student Intern David Anderson under the supervision attorney Gregory A. Renden. Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in custody. David Behm on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DD Crispy Restaurant at or about 800 N 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
